label: Construction of Buildings
description: Second course in building science and technology with emphases on the process of project execution from the initiation of design to the completion of construction of commercial, institutional, and other heavy construction building types. Includes comprehensive study of the construction of buildings and their systems, materials and methods, and their implications on building sustainability and design decision-making. CAD and BIM systems are used to develop construction documents for a case study building. Prerequisite: ARCH 231 or consent of instructor.
courseSectionInformation: Prerequisite: ARCH 231 or consent of instructor.
sectionRegistrationNotes: Restricted to Architectural Studies or Architecture major(s) or minor(s).
